definitions.definition: the full extent of something from end to end; the amount of space that something covers.
examples: a warehouse with a clear span of 28 feet

definitions.definition: the length of time for which something lasts.
synonyms: interval "the span of one working day"

definitions.definition: the wingspan of an aircraft or a bird.
examples: extent, length, width, reach, stretch, spread, distance, range a six-foot wing span

definitions.definition: an arch or part of a bridge between piers or supports.
the maximum distance between the tips of the thumb and little finger, taken as the basis of a measurement equal to 9 inches.
a short distance or time.
(of a bridge, arch, etc.) extend from side to side of.
examples: the stream was spanned by a narrow bridge
synonyms: pass over "an arch spanned the stream"

definitions.definition: extend across (a period of time or a range of subjects).
examples: their interests span almost all the conventional disciplines

definitions.definition: cover or enclose with the length of one's hand.
examples: her waist was slender enough for him to span with his hands

definitions.definition: a rope with its ends fastened at different points to a spar or other object in order to provide a purchase.
a team of people or animals, in particular.
a matched pair of horses, mules, or oxen.
the width of a person's hand, as measured from the tip of the thumb to the tip of the little finger, when the fingers and thumb are spread out.
turn or cause to turn or whirl around quickly.
examples: the girl spun around in alarm
synonyms: circle More"the bike wheels are spinning"whirl
pivot "she spun around to face him"

definitions.definition: (of a person's head) give a sensation of dizziness.
examples: the figures were enough to make her head spin

definitions.definition: impart a revolving motion to (a ball) when bowling.
(of a ball) move through the air with a revolving motion.
give (a news story or other information) a particular interpretation, especially a favorable one.
shape (sheet metal) by pressure applied during rotation on a lathe.
draw out (wool, cotton, or other material) and convert it into threads, either by hand or with machinery.
examples: they spin wool into the yarn for weaving

definitions.definition: make (threads) by drawing out and twisting fibers.
examples: this method is used to spin filaments from syrups

definitions.definition: (of a spider or a silkworm or other insect) produce (gossamer or silk) or construct (a web or cocoon) by extruding a fine viscous thread from a special gland.
fish with a spinner.
examples: they were spinning for salmon in the lake
